com.swirl

Class EventBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirl.EventBus

  • public class EventBus
extends java.lang.Object
    The EventBus is the main communication backbone of the library. All of the managers and listeners connect to this bus to receive events from the other participants. It ensures that events are dispatched on the thread the receiver is expecting to run on. THere are two main threads (accessed through Executors) of note: the mainLoopExecutor and the swirl internal ScheduledServiceExecutor. All the managers run on the latter, user added listeners run on the former.

    This system works by marking single parameter public methods with an @Subscribe annotation. The type of the single parameter must be unique. The events sent to the bus when posted are matched against all of the listeners and dispatches occur when and where there is a match.

    This class is documented for those that desire to catch events directly using the @Subscribe annotation and for those who want to write managers that might post() events onto the bus.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventBus

        public EventBus()

    • Method Detail

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Temporarily suspend event delivery. The EventBus starts in a suspended state. Events posted when the bus is suspended are queued for later delivery when delivery is resumed.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume delivery of events. Any queued events are delivered at this time.

      • getLastDispatchMillis

        public long getLastDispatchMillis()
        Get the timestamp of the last event dispatched.
        Returns:

      • addListener

        public void addListener(java.lang.Object listener,
                        java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Adds a listener to the bus provided it is not already a listener in which case this action does nothing. All events that this listener has @Subscribed to will be executed on the Executor provided.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that is listening for Events (or any class)
        executor - The executor that is used to call those event handlers.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(java.lang.Object listener)
        Remove a listener from the bus provided it is already a listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be removed.

      • findListener

        public java.lang.Object findListener(java.lang.Class aclass)
        Find a listener on the bus of a given class. Finds the first listener of a given class.
        Parameters:
        aclass - Class of the listener to find
        Returns:
        First instance of listener with aclass or null if none found

      • post

        public void post(java.lang.Object event)
        Post an event or object onto the bus. All listeners who implement public methods that have a single parameter with a matching class and an @Subscribe annotation will have those methods called.
        Parameters:
        event - The object to be dispatched.
